courseDetails.title: Learn FPGA Design with VHDL: Digital Logic & Simulation
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn FPGA Design with VHDL: Digital Logic, Simulation & Real Projects
courseDetails.longDescription:
Are you ready to dive into the world of digital hardware design and build real, working circuits on FPGAs? Practical FPGA Design with VHDL is a hands-on course that takes you from the very basics of FPGA concepts all the way to implementing real-world projects using VHDL. Whether you are a student, an electronics enthusiast, or a professional looking to upskill, this course is designed to make FPGA design practical, accessible, and rewarding.

We begin with a clear introduction to FPGA technology—what FPGAs are, their vendors, and why they power some of the most demanding applications today, from aerospace to high-speed trading systems. You will then strengthen your foundation with core digital logic design, including number systems, Boolean algebra, combinational and sequential circuits, and finite state machines, illustrated with real design examples like traffic light controllers and vending machines.

Next, we’ll explore FPGA architecture in detail, covering configurable logic blocks, interconnects, DSPs, and memory structures. You’ll then learn how to write efficient VHDL code, simulate it using industry tools such as GHDL and GTKWave, and bring your designs to life through step-by-step simulation projects like an AND gate and a seven-segment display decoder.

Finally, the course introduces you to key communication protocols—SPI, I2C, UART, AXI, Ethernet, PCIe, CAN, and HDMI—so you can understand how modern FPGAs interface with the outside world. (this section is not published yet and will be published soon)

By the end of this course, you will have both the theoretical understanding and the practical experience to confidently start your journey in FPGA design with VHDL.
targetAudiences: Hardware Engineers
Students in Electrical Engineering
FPGA Hobbyists

courseDetails.title: Energy Management System: ISO 50001 Masterclass
courseDetails.shortDescription: ISO 50001, Energy Management System, Energy Audit, EnMS Excel Tool, Energy performance, and ISO Lead Auditor, GHG, ESG
courseDetails.longDescription:
This comprehensive course provides a step-by-step understanding of ISO 50001:2018, the international standard for Energy Management Systems (EnMS).
The course follows the exact structure of the ISO 50001:2018 standard, ensuring you gain both theoretical knowledge and practical insight into each requirement:


Why Energy Management Systems (EnMS)
Understand why implementing ISO 50001:2018 is vital for organizations today. Learn how a well-structured EnMS helps reduce energy consumption, cut operational costs, and lower greenhouse gas emissions — all while improving competitiveness, compliance, and alignment with sustainability goals.

EnMS ISO 50001 Scope
Discover the scope and applicability of ISO 50001.  that can be applied to any organization, regardless of its type, size, or energy use.

Terms and Definitions
Get familiar with the key ISO 50001 concepts and terminology

Context of the Organization
Learn how to identify and analyze internal and external issues, understand the needs and expectations of interested parties, and define the scope and boundaries of your Energy Management System effectively.

Leadership
Understand how leadership commitment, energy policy, roles, responsibilities, and the energy management team contribute to the success of the system.

Planning
Master the planning process by identifying risks and opportunities, setting energy objectives and targets, and developing action plans. Learn how to conduct an energy review, determine significant energy uses (SEUs), establish energy baselines, and plan for effective data collection.

Support
Understand the resources needed for successful implementation — including competence, awareness, communication, and documentation. Learn how to ensure that everyone involved contributes effectively to energy performance improvement.

Operation
Explore how to implement operational controls, integrate energy performance in design, and apply energy-efficient procurement practices to sustain continual improvement.

Performance Evaluation
Learn how to measure, monitor, and analyze energy performance and system effectiveness. Understand how to conduct internal audits, evaluate compliance, and carry out management reviews to ensure continual improvement.

Improvement
Discover how to manage nonconformities, implement corrective actions, and drive continual improvement in both the EnMS and overall energy performance.


The course is valuable for any professional working in energy management, auditing, or consulting to this standard. Also, to those familiar with other ISO standards like ISO 9001, ISO 14001, and ISO 45001, who want to master EnMS ISO 50001.

After going through the videos in the course you will have a clear understanding of how an energy management system should be shaped, what its main elements are, what documents should exist, and how they should be implemented.
targetAudiences: Energy and sustainability managers
Energy auditors and ISO consultants
Management system professionals
Energy efficiency analysts
Consultants for Energy, ESG, Decarbonization, and GHG mitigations
Students & Early-Career Professionals in Engineering & Sustainability
Facility Managers & Operations Leaders
Or ANYONE who wants to cut energy costs, improve efficiency, and support global sustainability goals through ISO 50001.

courseDetails.shortDescription: Complete IPv6 training covering addressing, configuration tools, dual-stack networks, and transition methods
courseDetails.longDescription:
Implementing IPv6: Complete Guide to Modern Network Infrastructure

Master IPv6 Implementation with Hands-On Expertise

Transform your networking skills with this comprehensive 3-hour course designed for IT professionals ready to implement IPv6 in real-world environments. As IPv4 addresses become increasingly scarce, IPv6 adoption is no longer optional—it's essential for modern network infrastructure.

What You'll Learn

Foundation & Strategy

  • IPv6 Fundamentals: Master IPv6 addressing concepts, structure, and address types

  • IPv4 vs IPv6: Understand critical differences and migration considerations

  • Autoconfiguration: Implement automatic IPv6 address assignment strategies

Practical Implementation

  • Host Configuration: Configure IPv6 settings using multiple tools and methods

  • DHCPv6 Deployment: Set up and manage DHCPv6 servers with hands-on demonstrations

  • Coexistence Planning: Design networks that support both IPv4 and IPv6 simultaneously

Migration Excellence

  • Transition Technologies: Implement ISATAP, 6to4, and Teredo tunneling solutions

  • Native IPv6 Planning: Develop strategies for IPv6-only network environments

  • Real-World Scenarios: Navigate complex transition challenges with proven methodologies

Course Structure

4 Comprehensive Sections | 21 Lectures | Multiple Hands-On Demos

  1. IPv6 Addressing Mastery - Build your foundation with addressing concepts and knowledge checks

  2. Host Configuration Excellence - Master configuration tools through 6 practical demonstrations

  3. Coexistence Strategies - Plan and implement dual-stack environments

  4. Seamless Migration - Execute transitions using industry-standard protocols

Who Should Take This Course

  • Network Administrators preparing for IPv6 deployment

  • System Engineers managing modern network infrastructure

  • IT Professionals seeking IPv6 certification or career advancement

  • Technical Teams planning IPv4-to-IPv6 migration projects

Key Benefits

Hands-On Learning: 9+ practical demonstrations and real-world scenarios
Industry-Relevant: Current best practices and proven implementation strategies
Comprehensive Coverage: From basics to advanced transition technologies
Knowledge Validation: Built-in assessments to confirm your understanding
Career-Focused: Skills directly applicable to modern networking roles

Prerequisites

  • Basic understanding of TCP/IP networking concepts

  • Familiarity with network configuration tools

  • Access to a lab environment for hands-on practice (recommended)

Ready to future-proof your networking expertise? Enroll now and master the IPv6 skills that today's networks demand.
